api_key.description: This is the Redis Cloud API key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_ACCESS_KEY` environment variable.

secret_key.description: This is the Redis Cloud API secret key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_SECRET_KEY` environment variable.

url.description: This is the URL of Redis Cloud and will default to `https://api.redislabs.com/v1`. This can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_URL` environment variable.

sign_in_login_url.description: Cloud provider management console login URL

status.description: The current status of the account - `draft`, `pending` or `active`

block.description: Creates a Cloud Account resource representing the access credentials to a cloud provider account, (`AWS` or `GCP`). Your Redis Enterprise Cloud account uses these credentials to provision databases within your infrastructure.

memory_storage.description: Memory storage preference: either ‘ram’ or a combination of 'ram-and-flash’

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the subscription

payment_method.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. If credit card is specified, the payment method Id must be defined.

payment_method_id.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

cidrs.description: Set of CIDR ranges that are allowed to access the databases associated with this subscription

security_group_ids.description: Set of security groups that are allowed to access the databases associated with this subscription

cloud_account_id.description: Cloud account identifier. Default: Redis Labs internal cloud account (using Cloud Account Id = 1 implies using Redis Labs internal cloud account). Note that a GCP subscription can be created only with Redis Labs internal cloud account

provider.description: The cloud provider to use with the subscription, (either `AWS` or `GCP`)

multiple_availability_zones.description: Support deployment on multiple availability zones within the selected region

networking_vpc_id.description: Either an existing VPC Id (already exists in the specific region) or create a new VPC (if no VPC is specified)

region.description: Deployment region as defined by cloud provider

block.description: Cloud networking details, per region (single region or multiple regions for Active-Active cluster only)

average_item_size_in_bytes.description: Relevant only to ram-and-flash clusters. Estimated average size (measured in bytes) of the items stored in the database

memory_limit_in_gb.description: Maximum memory usage for each database

modules.description: Modules that will be used by the databases in this subscription.

throughput_measurement_value.description: Throughput value (as applies to selected measurement method)

block.description: Information about the planned databases used to optimise the database infrastructure. This information is only used when creating a new subscription and any changes will be ignored after this.
Creates a Subscription and database resources within your Redis Enterprise Cloud Account.

average_item_size_in_bytes.description: Relevant only to ram-and-flash clusters. Estimated average size (measured in bytes) of the items stored in the database

client_ssl_certificate.description: SSL certificate to authenticate user connections

data_eviction.description: (Optional) The data items eviction policy (either: 'allkeys-lru', 'allkeys-lfu', 'allkeys-random', 'volatile-lru', 'volatile-lfu', 'volatile-random', 'volatile-ttl' or 'noeviction'. Default: 'volatile-lru')

data_persistence.description: Rate of database data persistence (in persistent storage)

external_endpoint_for_oss_cluster_api.description: Should use the external endpoint for open-source (OSS) Cluster API

hashing_policy.description: List of regular expression rules to shard the database by. See the documentation on clustering for more information on the hashing policy - https://docs.redislabs.com/latest/rc/concepts/clustering/

memory_limit_in_gb.description: Maximum memory usage for this specific database

modules.description: Modules to be provisioned in the database

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the database

password.description: Password used to access the database. If left empty, the password will be generated automatically

periodic_backup_path.description: Path that will be used to store database backup files

private_endpoint.description: Private endpoint to access the database

protocol.description: The protocol that will be used to access the database, (either ‘redis’ or 'memcached’)

public_endpoint.description: Public endpoint to access the database

replica_of.description: Set of Redis database URIs, in the format `redis://user:password@host:port`, that this database will be a replica of. If the URI provided is Redis Labs Cloud instance, only host and port should be provided

source_ips.description: Set of CIDR addresses to allow access to the database

throughput_measurement_value.description: Throughput value (as applies to selected measurement method)

block.description: Set of alerts to enable on the database
Creates database resource within a subscription in your Redis Enterprise Cloud Account.

aws_account_id.description: AWS account id that the VPC to be peered lives in

aws_peering_id.description: Identifier of the AWS cloud peering

gcp_network_name.description: The name of the network to be peered

gcp_project_id.description: GCP project ID that the VPC to be peered lives in

gcp_redis_network_name.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise Cloud network to be peered

gcp_redis_project_id.description: Identifier of the Redis Enterprise Cloud GCP project to be peered

provider_name.description: The cloud provider to use with the vpc peering, (either `AWS` or `GCP`)

region.description: AWS Region that the VPC to be peered lives in

status.description: Current status of the account - `initiating-request`, `pending-acceptance`, `active`, `inactive` or `failed`

subscription_id.description: A valid subscription predefined in the current account

vpc_cidr.description: CIDR range of the VPC to be peered

vpc_id.description: Identifier of the VPC to be peered

block.description: Creates an AWS VPC peering for an existing Redis Enterprise Cloud Subscription, allowing access to your subscription databases as if they were on the same network.

access_key_id.description: The access key ID associated with the cloud account

exclude_internal_account.description: Whether to exclude the Redis Labs internal cloud account.

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the cloud account

provider_type.description: The cloud provider of the cloud account, (either `AWS` or `GCP`)

block.description: The Cloud Account data source allows access to the ID of a Cloud Account configuration.  This ID can be used when creating Subscription resources.

data_persistence.description: A list of data persistence option that can be applied to subscription databases

block.description: The data persistence data source allows access to a list of supported data persistence options.  Each option represents the rate at which a database will persist its data to storage.

alert.description: Set of alerts to enable on the database

data_persistence.description: The rate of database data persistence (in persistent storage)

hashing_policy.description: The list of regular expression rules the database is sharded by

memory_limit_in_gb.description: The maximum memory usage for the database

module.description: Redis modules that have been enabled on the database

name.description: The name of the database to filter returned databases

password.description: The password used to access the database - not present on `memcached` protocol databases

private_endpoint.description: Private endpoint to access the database

protocol.description: The protocol of the database to filter returned databases

public_endpoint.description: Public endpoint to access the database

region.description: The region of the database to filter returned databases

replica_of.description: The set of Redis database URIs, in the format `redis://user:password@host:port`, that this database will be a replica of

subscription_id.description: ID of the subscription that the database belongs to

support_oss_cluster_api.description: Supports the Redis open-source (OSS) Cluster API

block.description: The Database data source allows access to the details of an existing database within your Redis Enterprise Cloud account.
The Database data source allows access to the details of an existing database within your Redis Enterprise Cloud account.

card_type.description: Type of card that the payment method should be, such as `Visa`

exclude_expired.description: Whether to exclude any expired cards or not

last_four_numbers.description: Last four numbers of the card of the payment method

block.description: The Payment Method data source allows access to the ID of a Payment Method configured against your Redis Enterprise Cloud account. This ID can be used when creating Subscription resources.

provider_name.description: The name of the cloud provider to filter returned regions, (accepted values are `AWS` or `GCP`).

regions.description: A list of regions from either a single or multiple cloud providers

block.description: The Regions data source allows access to a list of supported cloud provider regions. These regions can be used with the subscription resource.

memory_storage.description: Memory storage preference: either ‘ram’ or a combination of 'ram-and-flash’

name.description: The name of the subscription to filter returned subscriptions

number_of_databases.description: The number of databases that are linked to this subscription

payment_method.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. Either 'credit-card' or 'marketplace'

payment_method_id.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

block.description: The Subscription data source allows access to the details of an existing subscription within your Redis Enterprise Cloud account.

peerings.description: A list of VPC peerings from either a single or multiple cloud providers

status.description: Current status of the account - `initiating-request`, `pending-acceptance`, `active`, `inactive` or `failed`

subscription_id.description: A valid subscription predefined in the current account

block.description: The Subscription Peerings data source allows access to a list of VPC peerings configured on the subscription.
